title.narrative: OUTPUT 2.4: HEALTH FACILITIES

description.narrative: 2014 Capacity development for cEmONC and family planning services for pre and in-service health workers.O-Y1&4:Strengthen skills and competency of health workers to provide quality maternal and child health services2015- Review of National Midwifery and newborn standards and inclusion in RIHS curriculum- In country training of health workers on revised midwifery and new born standards- Procurement of baby warmer (15nos)- Procurement of ultrasound machine (4nos)- Printing of MCH hand book for 2015-2016 fiscal year2016 - Development of national neonatal resuscitation training package- costing of every newborn action plan- develop KMC training package- review health facilities records to determine still birth rate- support supervision of maternal and neonatal health activities- Printing on MCH handbook- printing of midwifery and newborn standards2017- joint monitoring and supervision for MCH services- capacity building on KMC, NB resuscitation and EENC in the three referral hospitals and 4 BEmONC centers- KMC equipments and chairs for referral hospitals and CEmONC- PNC home visit to 20 districts- Participation of gyneacologist in regional fetal medicine CME- Training of health workers on web-based MCH tracking system for roll out to hospitals and BHUs- Observe World Premature day- Develop preconception package and pilot at JDWNRH- Coordinate with MECRIT to develop and incorporate Communication for Development (C4D) module for health promotion training in the curriculum of health workers, which contributes to Adolescent Health And Nutrition, Care And Treatment Of Children Affected By Hiv And Aids, Child Health, Community-Based Management Of Acute Malnutrition, Cross-Sectoral Planning And Programme Reviews, Hiv Prevention, Immunization, Infant And Young Child Feeding, Maternal And Newborn Health, Micronutrients, Nutrition And Emergencies, Nutrition And Hiv, Nutrition â€“ General, Pmtct And Infant Male Circumcision, Polio Eradication, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Treatment And Care Of Children Living With Hiv, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2018, increased and equitable access, utilization and quality of essential social services for all with a focus on women, children and youth, to sustain the MDGs and address emerging challenge

participating-org.narrative: DPA FOR BHUTAN CRICKET COUNCIL BOARD
DPA FOR BHUTAN YOUTH DEVELOPMENT FUND
DPA FOR HEALTH PROMOTION DIVISION MINISTRY OF HEALTH

mailing-address.narrative: Lhaki Lham 1-11 P.O. Box 239 Thimphu Bhutan

sector.narrative: Breastfeeding protection, promotion and support (including work on Code)
Community and home based maternal and newborn care
Diet diversity in early childhood (children under 5), includes complementary feeding and MNPs
Facility based maternal and newborn care (including emergency obstetric and newborn care, quality improvement)
IMNCI / Integrated Community Case Management (iCCM) - Community
Immunization supply chain, including cold chain
Maternal and newborn care policy advocacy, evidence generation, national / subnational capacity development
Technical assistance - Immunization (excluding Polio technical assistance)
Technical assistance - Treatment of severe acute malnutrition

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 2014 Capacity development for cEmONC and family planning services for pre and in-service health workers.O-Y1&4:Strengthenskills and competency of health workers to provide quality maternal and child health services2015- Review of National Midwiferyand newborn standards and inclusion in RIHS curriculum- In country training of health workers on revised midwifery and new bornstandards- Procurement of baby warmer (15nos)- Procurement of ultrasound machine (4nos)- Printing of MCH hand book for 2015-2016fiscal year2016 - Development of national neonatal resuscitation training package- costing of every newborn action plan-develop KMC training package- review health facilities records to determine still birth rate- support supervision of maternal andneonatal health activities- Printing on MCH handbook- printing of midwifery and newborn standards2017- joint monitoring andsupervision for MCH services- capacity building on KMC, NB resuscitation and EENC in the three referral hospitals and

description.narrative: Half of the newborns born in 2018 were reached with quality care package of Early Essential Newborn Care (EENC) & Kangaroo Mother Care (KMC). The first phase of the delivery of ‘multiple micronutrient powder' (MNP) project was initiated to reach 1,000 children 6-23 months in 3 districts. | Status:Met | As-of Date:30/01/2019

title.narrative: 2.4.3.4 Percentage of hospitals and BHUs implementing IMNCI, Care for Child Development and Growth Monitoring programme (Growth Monitoring)
ROSA 1: Neonatal mortality rate (deaths per 1000 live births)
2.4.5 Proportion of HIV positive pregnant women receiving ART
ROSA 3: Proportion (%) of children 0-59 months old whose height-for-age z-score (HAZ) is < -2
ROSA 3: Proportion of children 0-5 months old who are fed exclusively with breastmilk
ROSA 3: Proportion (%) of children 0-23 months old who were put to the breast within one hour of birth
2.4.2 Number of health facilities with comprehensive Emergency Obstetric and Neonatal Care (EmONC) services
ROSA 1: Percentage of live births attended by skilled health personnel
2.4.3.1 Percentage of hospitals and BHUs implementing IMNCI, Care for Child Development and Growth Monitoring programme (IMNCI BHUs)
2.4.1.1 Immunization coverage (DTP-HepB-Hib 3) and elimination status (Coverage)
(NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) ) IPV introduced into routine immunization schedules and country switched from trivalent Oral Polio Vaccine (tOPV) to bivalent Oral Polio Vaccine (bOPV)
(NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) ) National Multisectoral Committee for Nutrition available and functional
ROSA 2: Polio Free status maintained
